name: odd
content:
odd adjective
(STRANGE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 strange or unexpected: Her father was an odd man. What an odd thing to say. The skirt and jacket looked a little odd together. That's odd - I'm sure I put my keys in this drawer and yet they're not here. It's odd that no one's seen him. It must be odd to go back to your home town after forty years away. Synonyms

[ not gradable ] (of numbers) not able to be divided exactly by 2: Some examples of odd numbers are 1, 3, 5, and 7.

used after a number, esp. a number that can be divided by 10, to show that the exact number is not known: He holds another 50-odd acres of land in reserve, providing plenty of room for expansion.
